item.title: INFs and unrounded answers
item.description: Let's look at the example shown back in section 2.1: In the above case, the formula for the volume of a sphere was probably directly used to calculate and display the answer - something like this, for example: $radius = mt_rand(5, 15); $answer = 4 / 3 * pi() * ($radius ** 3); However, using pi() in calculations will give you messy numbers, and PHP will give the value to the most precision it can - 10 or so decimal places, in this case.
